parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the custom terminology being retrieved.

parameters.name: TerminologyDataFormat
parameters.description: The data format of the custom terminology being retrieved. If you don't specify this parameter, Amazon Translate returns a file with the same format as the file that was imported to create the terminology. If you specify this parameter when you retrieve a multi-directional terminology resource, you must specify the same format as the input file that was imported to create it. Otherwise, Amazon Translate throws an error.

nested_items.name: TerminologyProperties
nested_items.description: The properties of the custom terminology being retrieved.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the custom terminology.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the custom terminology properties.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom terminology.

nested_items.name: SourceLanguageCode
nested_items.description: The language code for the source text of the translation request for which the custom terminology is being used.

nested_items.name: TargetLanguageCodes
nested_items.description: The language codes for the target languages available with the custom terminology resource. All possible target languages are returned in array.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EncryptionKey
nested_items.description: The encryption key for the custom terminology.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of encryption key used by Amazon Translate to encrypt this object.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key being used to encrypt this object.

nested_items.name: SizeBytes
nested_items.description: The size of the file used when importing a custom terminology.

nested_items.name: TermCount
nested_items.description: The number of terms included in the custom terminology.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the custom terminology was created, based on the timestamp.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the custom terminology was last update, based on the timestamp.

nested_items.name: Directionality
nested_items.description: The directionality of your terminology resource indicates whether it has one source language (uni-directional) or multiple (multi-directional).

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Additional information from Amazon Translate about the terminology resource.

nested_items.name: SkippedTermCount
nested_items.description: The number of terms in the input file that Amazon Translate skipped when you created or updated the terminology resource.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The format of the custom terminology input file.

nested_items.name: TerminologyDataLocation
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the most recent custom terminology input file that was successfully imported into Amazon Translate. The location is returned as a presigned URL that has a 30-minute expiration.

nested_items.name: RepositoryType
nested_items.description: The repository type for the custom terminology data.

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the most recent custom terminology input file that was successfully imported into Amazon Translate. The location is returned as a presigned URL that has a 30-minute expiration .

nested_items.name: AuxiliaryDataLocation
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of a file that provides any errors or warnings that were produced by your input file. This file was created when Amazon Translate attempted to create a terminology resource. The location is returned as a presigned URL to that has a 30-minute expiration.

nested_items.name: RepositoryType
nested_items.description: The repository type for the custom terminology data.

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the most recent custom terminology input file that was successfully imported into Amazon Translate. The location is returned as a presigned URL that has a 30-minute expiration .
